      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object o)
        An efficient check for equality. It only checks the bases, first, if the number of bases is equal, and then if the base values (object and strategy parameters) are the same.
        Specified by:
        equals in class Chromosome
        Returns:
        equal The equality of the passed object with this object.

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
        An efficient hash code. Uses Vector.hashCode(). It just uses the object bases for hashing, however, use of the fitness repository does not seem to make any sense, as no single real chromosome will be the same as any other.
        Specified by:
        hashCode in class Chromosome
        Returns:
        hashCode A more or less correct hash code.

      • doMutation

        public void doMutation()
        Mutate by adding normal noise with constant, single, or specific standard deviation (strategy parameters). First, the strategy parameter(s) are mutated as [sigma_i,new = sigma_i,old * exp(tau'N(0, 1) + tau N_i(0, 1))] (where N(0, 1) is the same for all i). Then the object parameters are mutated as [o_i,new = o_i,old + N(0, sigma_i,new)]. [tau = 1/sqrt(2 * sqrt(n))], [tau' = 1/sqrt(2n)], where n is the number of object parameters. If strategy is NONE, the length of the constant interval [low, high] scaled by the mutation rate is used as standard deviation.
        Specified by:
        doMutation in class Chromosome

      • doCrossover

        public void doCrossover(Chromosome father)
        Discrete recombination of two random parents. Obeying the crossover rate object parameters are exchanged with p = 0.5. In GA terms this is Uniform Crossover.
        Specified by:
        doCrossover in class Chromosome
        Parameters:
        father - A parent Chromosome.

      • mixSoup

        public void mixSoup()
        Initial creation of the alleles. Doubles for object parameters are randomly drawn from the user defined range with uniform distribution (eventually biased). The random values for the strategy parameter(s) are derived using 'mutationRate'. The mutation rate is the range of initial sigma value(s). The range is calculated as a percentage (=mutation rate) of the range high - low. The strategy parameters are then uniformly sampled from this initial range of sigma. If strategy == NONE, the mutation rate is never adapted.
        Specified by:
        mixSoup in class Chromosome

        public double getLow()

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Convert chromosome (object parameters) to string. The first base (the leftmost) has index 0.
        Specified by:
        toString in class Chromosome

      • fromString

        public void fromString(java.lang.String b)
        Create bases from String. The syntax of the string must be like this: "1.3|2.4|3.5|4.34|", where the numbers are just examples, but the '|' character must be exactly at the given spots. Note that we only deal with object bases, the strategy bases are initialized using random numbers.
        Specified by:
        fromString in class Chromosome
        Parameters:
        b - a String describing the object bases
